comments.text:
Thank you dear friend and I am so happy for you. I know your Father is

comments.text:
You already are that man, and one day you'll be able to show it more 
completely :)

And thank you, it's Sept 12th in S ydney Australia.   I was thinking 
earlier this week that I needed to email you and get your address to send 
an announcement.
comments.author: Emma Markey

comments.text:
You know I am always here for you! One day I hope to be that man.

Joy to you in this most glorious time. When is the date, if you don't mind 
my asking?:)

comments.text:
Scott, I hope you always retain that hope yet never HAVE to use it.
Serena, its so cute you think you are old =^P.
Such a beautiful message. This couple was a very interesting choice to use 
for this, because niether seem old enough for thier conditions to be caused 
by old age, which would make many people depressed to lose out on so much 
life.
An awsome way for the church to DEEPEN the inspiration af the message.
comments.author: Brent Elder

comments.text: That's great! Getting old sucks.

comments.text:
Amen Sister! I feel the same way. I feel especially that in Young Womens 
for me, they drill me in every lesson to find the right guy and get married 
in the temple. they drill it so much that it is one of the most important 
things to me and I want to be worthy for that!

comments.text:
My little siblings that were with me didn't understand why I was crying so 
much. I want a husband  like that. I wish I could be so selfless like him.
